moves.1. e4: My First Annotated game, all comments and tips greatly appreciated
moves.1... c5: Sicilian defence, one of my favorites
moves.2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4: Unusual move by white here, I was unable to find this variant in the database. More common would be d4 as white would gain advantage in the centre. This also breaks the rule of knights before bishops
moves.4... h6: defended here rather than taking d4 pawn as I would lose, but hoping for d5 from white
moves.5. d5 Na5 6. Be2 exd5 7. exd5 Nf6: I feel this move was a mistake by me. Whites central pawn is going to be my undoing
moves.8. O-O b6: hoping to get the bishop onto the d5 pawn
moves.10. Bb5+ Bd7 11. Re1+ Be7 12. Bxd7+: I think this was a mistake by white. Perhaps 12 Bxd6 Bxb5 13 Rxe7+ Kf8 14 Rd7+ and the loss of my queen
moves.12... Qxd7 13. Nc3 O-O-O: I felt safer castling queen side in this situation due to the threat of the bishop opening up my defense on the king side had I castled the opp side
moves.14. Qd3: white spots my weakness but better is 14 Qe2 threatening the check in the corner and Qxe7
moves.15... Rhe8: In hindsight I should have done Rde8 here.
moves.16. a4 Nh5: hoping to open up my bishop here
